law.catch_line: Criminal falsification of a medical record -- Penalties.

text.section: A person is guilty of criminal falsification of a medical record when he or she knowingly and unlawfully falsifies, alters, or creates a medical record for the purpose of obtaining or attempting to obtain a controlled substance with intent to violate this chapter.
Any person who violates any subsection of this section shall be guilty of a Class D felony for the first offense and a Class C felony for a second or subsequent offense.

law.history: Created 2007 Ky. Acts ch. 124, sec. 7, effective June 26, 2007.
